  • Constructor Details

    • DWGraph_DS

      public DWGraph_DS()

    • DWGraph_DS

      public DWGraph_DS​(directed_weighted_graph g)
      This constructor is mainly used by copy() method in WGraph_Algo class The implement this method is by Hashtables represents nodes, edges and reversed edges. In the first loop initialize the Hashtables: first add each vertex to each Hashtable. then perform iterations on the neighbors of the vertices of the old graph and isomorphically add to the new graph the same list of edges by the edge_data copy constructor. Finally copy the 'MC', 'degree' variables. (MC = The number of actions required to create the graph [g.nodeSize() + g.edgeSize()]).

  • Method Details

    • getNode

      public node_data getNode​(int key)
      About getNode(int key) method: this method return the node_data by the node_id. the method return null if none as requested.
      Specified by:
      getNode in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      key - - the node_id
      Returns:
      the node_data by the node_id, null if none.

    • getEdge

      public edge_data getEdge​(int src, int dest)
      About getEdge(int src, int dest) method: this method return the edge_data object. the method return -1 if node1 or node2 aren't in the graph. the method return -1 if node1==node2 (There is no edge from a Node to itself). the method return null in case there is no such edge. the implementation of the method is simply by 'get' method in '_graph' Hashmap [O(1)].
      Specified by:
      getEdge in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      src -
      dest -
      Returns:

    • addNode

      public void addNode​(node_data n)
      About addNode(node_data n) method: this method add a new node to the graph with the given node_data object. if n==null or there is already a node with such a key no action performed. the method is implemented by adding the node to each Hashmaps in this class. if the method is implemented we update the MC (Mode Count).
      Specified by:
      addNode in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      key -

    • connect

      public void connect​(int src, int dest, double w)
      About connect(int node1, int node2, double w) method: this method connect an edge between node1 and node2, with an edge with weight>=0. the method implemented only if node1 or node2 in the graph, node1!=node2 and w>=0. if the edge node1-node2 already exists the method updates the weight of the edge. (in case the existing edge weight == w no action performed). if there is no such edge the method adds each Node to the list of neighbors [Hashmap] of the other Node [O(1)] and updates 'degree' variable. if any action performed the method updates 'MC' variable.
      Specified by:
      connect in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      src - - the source of the edge.
      dest - - the destination of the edge.
      w - - positive weight representing the cost (aka time, price, etc) between src-->dest.

    • getV

      public java.util.Collection<node_data> getV()
      About getV() method: This method return a pointer (shallow copy) for the collection representing all the nodes in the graph. the method is implemented by returning '_graph' HashMap values.
      Specified by:
      getV in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Returns:
      Collection

    • getE

      public java.util.Collection<edge_data> getE​(int node_id)
      About getE(int node_id) method: This method returns a collection containing all the edges connected to node_id. the method returning null if node_id isn't in the graph. The implementation of the method is simply by returning the HashMap values of node_id neighbors.
      Specified by:
      getE in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Returns:
      Collection

    • removeNode

      public node_data removeNode​(int key)
      About removeNode(int key) method: this method delete the node (with the given ID) from the graph - and removes all edges which starts or ends at this node. the method return null if the Node isn't in the graph as requested. otherwise the method performs an iteration on all the neighbors of the Node [O(n)] and removes his connected edges one by one while each step updates the MC (Mode Count). afterwards the method removes the Node itself [O(1)] while returning pointer to the node and update the MC (Mode Count) once again. (another solution on commit no. 736f2897)
      Specified by:
      removeNode in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      key -
      Returns:
      the data of the removed node (null if none).

    • removeEdge

      public edge_data removeEdge​(int src, int dest)
      About removeEdge(int src, int dest) method: This method delete the edge from the graph. the method returns null if src node or dest node aren't in the graph. if src node and dest node are neighbors the method removes the edge between them by removing each Node from the list of neighbors [Hashmap] of the other one [O(1)]. afterwards the method update Degree variable used for counting the edges and also update the MC (Mode Count).
      Specified by:
      removeEdge in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Parameters:
      src -
      dest -
      Returns:
      the data of the removed edge (null if none).

    • nodeSize

      public int nodeSize()
      About nodeSize() method: this method return the number of vertices (nodes) in the graph. The implementation of the method is simply by returning '_graph' size [O(1)].
      Specified by:
      nodeSize in interface directed_weighted_graph
      Returns:

    • edgeSize

      public int edgeSize()
      About edgeSize() method: this method return the number of edges (directional graph). The implementation of the method is simply by returning node neighbors size [Hashmap > O(1)].
      Specified by:
      edgeSize in interface directed_weighted_graph

      public int getMC()
      About getMC() method: this method return the Mode Count - for testing changes in the graph. The implementation of the method is simply by returning 'MC' variable.
      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object g)
      About equals(Object g) method: this is an auxiliary method mainly for testing copy()/save()/load() methods. the method returns false if the input object isn't instanceof directed_weighted_graph. otherwise calls equals(directed_weighted_graph g) method [below].
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      g -
      Returns:
      boolean

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(directed_weighted_graph g)
      About equals(directed_weighted_graph g) method: this method compares this graph with the input graph. if this nodes size != g nodes size or this edges size != g edges size - return false (the graphs obviously not equals). otherwise the method performs iteration on all g vertices: for each vertex - the method check if this graph contains vertex with same key and checks equality using node 'equals' method. if g vertex neighbors size != this vertex neighbors size - return false (the graphs obviously not equals). otherwise, the method perform iteration on the vertex neighbors and checks existence and equality of each neighbor using edge 'equals' method. # There is no need to check equation between MC variables because the purpose of the test # is equality between the graphs and not for the number of operations performed on them.
      Parameters:
      g -
      Returns:
      boolean
